perturbation.original_text: Except as provided hereinafter, for a period of five years after termination or expiration of this Agreement, each party shall not disclose, publish or disseminate information received from the other party which may be required to carry out this Agreement and which the disclosing party deems proprietary and confidential.

perturbation.explanation: Reducing the confidentiality period to one year could violate trade secret laws or other regulations that require longer protection periods for proprietary information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates trade secret laws, depending on the nature of the confidential information and applicable jurisdiction. Some jurisdictions may require longer protection periods.

perturbation.original_text: If the commission members are not able to resolve a conflict or a problem in the interpretation of this Agreement within thirty natural days, the representatives of the parties will be duly informed in order to find a solution on friendly terms.
perturbation.changed_text: If the commission members are not able to resolve a conflict or a problem in the interpretation of this Agreement within fifteen natural days, the representatives of the parties will be duly informed in order to find a solution on friendly terms.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the resolution period to fifteen days may not provide sufficient time for complex disputes, potentially violating principles of fair dispute resolution.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with legal principles requiring reasonable time for dispute resolution; may contradict specific arbitration or mediation rules mandating longer periods.
